page.title: 08Wringworthy Farm(Peter Tavy)
page.content: Wringworthy Farm is near the A386.The house is very old and is mentioned in the original Domesday Book as Wering Gertha.In their large dining room is a piece of linenfold panelling which probably came from Tavistock Abbey at the time of the dissolution. Wringworthy Farm consists of 140 acres, 80 of which are around the farmhouse while the remaining 60 acres are rented at Mary Tavy.Mr.Anning,who owns the farm,keeps 55 dairy cows and about 80 young stock.Twelve years ago his farm was a mixed farm as he grew a few crops and kept some sheep as well as keeping cattle.He now concentrates on dairy farming.He milks his cows at 7a.m.and 5p.m and they produce 5400 k.g of milk a year.The heifers have their first calf when they are 2\ and the calves are born between August and March.
